info.title: USA Today Snapshots
info.description: Using the USA TODAY Snapshots API, developers will be able to construct their own custom feeds for USA TODAY Snapshots. Snapshots are easy-to-read statistical graphics that present information on various issues and trends in a visually appealing way, posted online every day Monday through Friday. Snapshots data is available in a custom handler.

get.description: Using the USA TODAY Snapshots API, developers will be able to construct their own custom feeds for USA TODAY Snapshots. Snapshots are easy-to-read statistical graphics that present information on various issues and trends in a visually appealing way, posted online every day Monday through Friday. Snapshots data is available in a custom handler.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: The API key used for the query

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Use this parameter to define the date that a snapshot was created, in terms of elapsed days. If you wish to define the published date instead of the creation date, append &date=publishedDate to your query.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: These variables are used to define the starting and ending date for a snapshot call, and may be used together in order to establish a time range. Both parameters use MM/DD/YYYY formatting.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Use this parameter to return a specific snapshot, setting the id variable to a specific snapshots unique identification number

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Use this parameter to to search snapshots based on tag. Note that spaces should be input as +, and multiple keywords should be separated by commas.

parameters.name: last
parameters.description: By default, the Snapshots API will return the single latest snapshot. Setting last to any number will return that many of the latest snapshots.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: Set section to any one of our fronts (life, news, sports, etc.) to pull snapshots exclusively from that section.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: These variables are used to define the starting and ending date for a snapshot call, and may be used together in order to establish a time range. Both parameters use MM/DD/YYYY formatting.
